Posts.Content: Apr 5, 2008 04:08AM Jill_45 wrote: Well I am in for April. I am having a sentinel node biospy and a re excision to try to get clean margins this time on April 21st. I am just starting to heal nicely from my lumpectomy 3 weeks ago and now they are going to cut it again.(sigh). I even thought I could get away with just day surgery but no way as they are keeping me in for 24 hours this time. Maybe they can knock me out enough to catch up on all the sleep, lol. Hope you all have a great weekend. Jill.

Posts.Content: Apr 20, 2008 09:47AM Jill_45 wrote: Thanks Sam 408. I have to be at the hospital at 10:30 tomorrow for the prep of the SNB and then surgery is at 1:40. have to stay overnight this time so will be back home on Tuesday. Good luck to everyone else having surgery and to those who have had theirs this month I wish you all a speedy recovery. Jill.

Posts.Content: Apr 23, 2008 07:39PM Jill_45 wrote: Hi All. I got back home yesterday from having my surgery on Monday and it is a lot tougher this time after just having the last surgery 6 weeks ago. I had a SNB done and re-excision this time and should get the pathology report next week. Hopefully as long as the nodes are clear it will be just radiation. My first appointment with the oncologist is May 14th.  Hope everyone who has had surgery so far this week is doing good. Jill.

Posts.Content: Feb 16, 2009 03:49PM Jill_45 wrote: Laura. I was told that even the removal of any nodes that you have to be careful. I have high blood pressure and was told that I should not have my blood pressure taken on that side. I was wondering also that you say you had all your nodes removed on that side so I am a little curious as to how many there are as I see so many that are a higher number than yours that have been removed and I know of a few girls that have had 29 nodes removed on one side. Posts.Content: Apr 1, 2008 02:02PM Jill_45 wrote: Viv, can he not go online and get them. That's what my Doctor did after 7 days as my Surgeon was on holidays and I would have had to wait 2 weeks otherwise. He knew my frustration that day I saw him and so he stayed in the office after hours, got it online and then called me that night with the results. Not that I really wanted to hear that news over the phone but better than waiting. Now I have to wait for a call from a new surgeon as mine doesn't do the SNB and have to to have a re excision done as well. Waitng does funny things to the mind!!!!! Jill.
